summary: This document is an invoice from FedEx addressed to Jeffrey E. Epstein for shipping services. It details charges related to a shipment sent from Epstein to the Bristol Hotel in New York City, including customs duties and other fees. The invoice highlights the financial transactions associated with Epstein's shipping activities.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey E. Epstein is the individual to whom the invoice is addressed, indicating he is both the sender and recipient of the shipment detailed in the document.

persons.name: Jean Mare Burtel
persons.context: Jean Mare Burtel is mentioned as the recipient of a package sent by Epstein to the Bristol Hotel in New York.

connections.description: Epstein sent a package to Burtel at the Bristol Hotel in New York.

events.title: Shipment Sent
events.description: A package was shipped by Jeffrey E. Epstein to Jean Mare Burtel at the Bristol Hotel.

events.title: Package Delivered
events.description: The package sent by Epstein was delivered to the Bristol Hotel.

locations: Bristol Hotel, 457 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10022
keyFacts: The invoice is dated October 9, 2003, and pertains to shipping charges incurred by Jeffrey E. Epstein.
The total amount due on the invoice is $116.11, which includes duties and taxes.
The shipment was sent on October 3, 2003, and was delivered on October 6, 2003.
The recipient of the shipment was Jean Mare Burtel, indicating a business or personal connection.
The document includes references to customs duties and fees associated with international shipping.
